title: Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

last_post.content:
I am going to keep posting about this until we get to 100,000 signatures.

You are going to be seeing this post from this obsessed woman's for a long time. You have the means to stop me posting.

As I write there are 91,064 signatures on the petition. That is an additional 101 signatures since this time yesterday. At this rate the date for hitting 100,000 signatures is Friday 12 May, 88 days away.

If anyone can think of any method of getting this message out to other people then please do so

The last we thing we want is the petition to remove LGBT content from the curriculum to be debated and our opinion not to be heard.

Please sign if you are a UK citizen and please boost if you are not.

May I take this opportunity to thank each and everyone of the 1,860 people that have boosted this message so far.
💖 ❤️ 💖 ❤️

Petition: Do not remove LGBT content from the Relationships Education curriculum

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/631529

#TransRightsAreHumanrRghts #Trans

title: StreetPass for Mastodon

last_post.content:
StreetPass is a cool new browser extension that uses Mastodon's verification system in a clever way.

Mastodon users verify themselves by adding a custom link to their personal site. StreetPass lets you know when you've found one of these links, and adds them to your list. As you browse the web, StreetPass will build a list of Mastodon users that belong to the websites you visit.

I spoke with the creater @tvler about the project, 🧵 below.

Visit https://streetpass.social/ to try it yourself!

title: Childbirth Is Deadlier for Black Families Even When They’re Rich, Expansive Study Finds

last_post.content:
The New York Times gathered infant mortality data for California and documented the intense effects that racism has on outcomes

Babies of the wealthiest Black mothers were more likely to die in their first year than babies of the poorest white mothers

The whole piece is here; this is a “friend” link so you can read it even if you’re not a subscriber: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2023/02/12/upshot/child-maternal-mortality-rich-poor.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUyYiZ_tU1Gw5CRWySB4B99Vre37-WmvshnmT-KzTSQjZDy-hQBoGc9l3LbK4mYtwpwz2fRcNQdaUuT_w31uhYJQptVwys6NOiqagyHh8U-8i1T39kmNXMW6w16zbhcminJaBxneHm4EOLO33qD6ffzXFxcAt68pNhdUWq0SRelv2SG-9z2tJuzLx2UMABMDQHZiaBuPfrCwwve4nVK0GBtXRlHr1RSjrRntSD6rkfcA40CV7OSHJ34G9U-8oLcZpMf_65d0h8DZK41bYBCWVoLpOrBIkxQOXXk7ZtuL3PqX-c2a5Vh8QB9baqTnwJncGty80&referringSource=articleShare

title: Journalism is Lossy Compression - Whither news? - Medium

last_post.content:
From my weekend:
"For what is journalism itself but lossy compression of the world?... For that matter, what is a library or a museum or a curriculum but lossy compression — that which fits? What is culture but lossy compression of creativity? As Umberto Eco said, “Now more than ever, we realize that culture is made up of what remains after everything else has been forgotten."

https://medium.com/whither-news/journalism-is-lossy-compression-86380f0bdb50

title: Fewer followers, more engagement: What I found in a Twitter-versus-Mastodon test

last_post.content:
Journalists like @dankennedy_nu are beginning to notice that Mastodon has more engagement than Twitter.

For me, this has been true for a long time. Engagement on Twitter is like winning the lottery. Whereas, on Mastodon, engagement is just a fact of life when using the service.

If the point of social media is to be *social*, the Mastodon beats the pants off of Twitter.

https://dankennedy.net/2023/02/12/fewer-followers-more-engagement-what-i-found-in-a-twitter-versus-mastodon-test/

title: Does Autocorrect Make Life Better? - Towards Data Science

last_post.content: Des limites de la correction automatique aux limites de l'apprentissage automatique : https://towardsdatascience.com/does-autocorrect-make-life-better-aebafbed09f0 - La correction automatique fonctionne selon un calcul de probabilité pour choisir le prochain ou le bon mot d'un message. Mais ce calcul n'est pas sans lacunes, notamment quand il remplace un mot par un autre, sans nous avertir clairement.

title: This Tool Could Protect Artists From A.I. Image Generators

last_post.content: The artist revolt against AI-powered art generators is in full swing. Artists have filed a class-action lawsuit in California against Stability AI and Midjourney. They've raised money for a D.C. lobbyist. And soon they will have a technological countermeasure, a tool designed by U of Chicago computer scientists that will "cloak" art posted online so that it won't be "feeding this monster that becomes more and more like them." My latest: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/02/13/technology/ai-art-generator-lensa-stable-diffusion.html

title: Twitter exec says 'hundreds of thousands' of Russian disinformation accounts still active on Twitter

last_post.content:
I wrote about the most-overlooked part of Wednesday’s Oversight Committee hearing: The revelation that “thousands, maybe hundreds of thousands” of Russian disinformation accounts are still active on the platform, waging an ongoing war on reality.

This is the first we’ve heard of an ongoing foreign disinfo campaign of this magnitude, and the implications are staggering.

title: Garrick Aden-Buie

last_post.content:
A little big personal update: I'm happy to share that today is my first day as a Software Engineer on team #Shiny for #RStats! ✨

It's been an honor to work with the awesome folks making @Posit Academy 🎓 and now I'm just as excited to build awesome open source web tools!

Oh and when I went to update my bio I accidentally migrated my website to #QuartoPub https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/

title: The caucus trying to prevent AI-pocalypse | Semafor

last_post.content:
“You'd be surprised at how much time I spend educating my colleagues about the fact that the biggest risks of AI are not the creation of an army of evil robots with red laser eyes taking over the world,” said Rep. Jay Obernolte, R-Calif.

https://www.semafor.com/article/02/13/2023/the-members-of-congress-trying-to-prevent-ai-pocalypse
